DOC.brief_summary: To assess feasibility conduct large cluster randomize control trial facilitate effectiveness complex Knowledge Translation ( KT ) intervention , i.e . implementation multimodal care , chiropractic clinical practice , design improve management patient Non-Specific Neck Pain ( NSNP ) disorder . To evaluate feasibility , investigator ascertain well participate chiropractor patient adhere study protocol solicit feedback overall usefulness content format KT intervention . This study determine plan main study also outcomes used primary outcome .
DOC.brief_title: Testing Feasibility Intervening Optimize Chiropractic Care Adults With Neck Pain Disorders
DOC.detailed_description: The aim pilot study project determine feasibility implementing multifaceted KT intervention promote use multimodal care chiropractor manage patient NSNP . Design : Cluster randomize control pilot feasibility trial . Chiropractors private practice Canada randomize receive either theory-based tailored KT intervention experimental group simply print copy guideline control group . Study population sample size : 30 chiropractor recruit random , nationally representative sample 200 chiropractor . Each chiropractor recruit five neck pain patient total 150 patient . The design KT intervention inform result related qualitative study ( Theoretical Domains Framework interview ) consist series three webinars , two online case scenario , self-management video Brief Action Planning ( BAP ) print copy practice guideline ( Bussi√®res et al. , 2015 ) . Primary feasibility outcome chiropractor patient include rate : 1 ) recruitment , 2 ) study retention , 3 ) adherence intervention ( Tickle-Degnen , 2013 ) . A checklist proxy measure embed within patient encounter form use assess chiropractor ' compliance guideline recommendation e.g. , exercise self-care prescription , study onset three month follow-up . Secondary outcome include whether chiropractor 's recommend multimodal care , score measure behavioural construct e.g. , self-efficacy , knowledge . Primary clinical outcome patient include measure pain intensity neck pain-specific disability . Analyses pilot study focus generate point estimate correspond 95 % confidence interval parameter priori interest ( e.g. , recruitment , retention , adherence , pain intensity , neck disability index ) . Discussion : The main strength study include use representative sample randomize controlled design . The result study inform design large cluster randomize controlled trial aim confirm effectiveness increase use multimodal care chiropractor manage patient NSNP .
DOC.criteria: Chiropractors Inclusion criterion : Registered professional licensing board private practice Canada ; Graduated least one year ago ; Provide chiropractic treatment minimum two adult ( age 1865 ) neck pain per week ; Speak English French ; Have access Internet . Exclusion criterion : Chiropractors exclude already attended webinar series selfmanagement learn module . Prior webinar learn module participant need register beforehand , therefore provide mechanism confirm study ineligibility . Patients Inclusion criterion : Attend consent chiropractor nonspecific neck pain duration ; Aged 18 65 , primary complaint acute ( < 3 month ) chronic ( > 3 month ) neck pain present new condition treatment participate clinic ; Fluency English French level read understand study information sheet , complete consent form , respond telephoneadministered questionnaire . This assessed staff member chiropractor 's team time screen ; Provide write informed consent . Exclusion criterion : Previous neck surgery ; Presence Red flag ; Pregnancy ; Chiropractic care receive precede 3 month complaint neck pain
